Package plotly.fastCharts

Class PlotlyBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • plotly.fastCharts.PlotlyBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable
    public class PlotlyBar
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
    Invoke this class to build a fast Bar chart.
    Call PlotlyBar(Composite parent, int style, double[][][] datas) to obtain this composite.

    Exemple:
    String[][][] barDatas = { { { "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Oct", "Nov", "Dec" }, { "20", "14", "25", "16", "18", "22", "19", "15", "12", "16", "14", "17" } }, { { "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", "Apr", "May", "Jun", "Jul", "Aug", "Sep", "Oct", "Nov", "Dec" }, { "19", "14", "22", "14", "16", "19", "15", "14", "10", "12", "12", "16" } } };
    PlotlyBar pb = new PlotlyBar(HomeComposite, SWT.NONE, barDatas);
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benoit Boucounaud

      • getSelectedDatas

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getSelectedDatas()
        Return the selected data.
        Returns:
        Map<String, List<String>> - Map of selected data.

        Keys :
        • "curveNumber" : index in data of the trace associated with the selected points
        • "pointNumber" : index of the selected points
        • "x" : x values
        • "y" : y values

      • upColors

        public void upColors​(java.lang.String[] colors)
        To update trace's color.
        When you change color, all marker's values are delete, only new color stay.
        Parameters:
        colors - String[] - Arrays of traces colors (ex : [ "rgb(158,202,225)", "rgb(8,48,107)"] )

      • upBarMode

        public void upBarMode​(java.lang.String mode)
        To update bar mode.
        Values : "stack" | "group" | "overlay" | "relative"
        Determines how bars at the same location coordinate are displayed on the graph. With "stack", the bars are stacked on top of one another With "relative", the bars are stacked on top of one another, with negative values below the axis, positive values above With "group", the bars are plotted next to one another centered around the shared location. With "overlay", the bars are plotted over one another, you might need to an "opacity" to see multiple bars.
        Parameters:
        colors - String[] - Arrays of traces colors (ex : [ ["jan", "feb"], [2018,2019] ]

      • upWidths

        public void upWidths​(double[][] widths)
        To update traces's widths.
        Parameters:
        widths - double[][] - Arrays of traces's widths (ex : [ [0.8, 0.9, 1.2],[0.5, 0.8, 0.7]])

      • upBases

        public void upBases​(double[][] bases)
        To update traces's bases.
        Parameters:
        bases - double[][] - Arrays of traces colors (ex : [ [-500, -13.2],[-30, -25.4]])

        public void upBarGap​(double gap)
